author: redbeardlegoman
title: No Construction Site is Complete Without One
review:
I tried, with mixed success, to design something similar to this a few years back.

What my MOC was lacking was a simple way to convey the message for caution.  And really, that's the beating heart of such a vehicle.

With the inclusion of a single printed tile, all of that is taken care of.

That single tile, too, is very nicely done.  The blue circle with the minifigure head is very well-designed, and aesthetically pleasing.  

There's really not much that needs to be said about this set.  It succeeds admirably at what it sets out to do.  Two or three of them would be perfectly suited to any construction site.

Don't let this one pass you by.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Perfect Accessory for LEGO City Road Work Teams
review:
Set #30357 Road Worker: Construction theme Polybags are often small road work equipment or, in past cases we’ve seen a ride-on lawn mower and a few other interesting models. This one adds more fun little vehicle ideas for LEGO City Construction, and a much needed sign to alert driver’s to Men at Work.

Pros:

  • Affordable fun little model with unique printed element.

  • Construction Worker Minifigure uses the same parts as you’d come to expect.

  • Model makes good use of parts, rolls well and features interesting mechanic to store sign on back with droid arms and technic elements.

  • New front bumper element included with set.

Cons:

  • Limited number of parts for price.

  • Lacks interesting accessories.

Overall opinion

Not a bad little Polybag and very solidly put together. The inclusion of a printed sign element is very welcome and folks looking for that part may desire to pick multiples up for that very reason. Strongly recommended.

author: StevenTheBrick
title: Road Worker
review:
2/5

 

Building Experience was meh. Parts and playability are mediocre. The price is ok.

author: BrickBuiltBill
title: Simple & Fun
review: Nice 4-wide vehicle; would fit in perfectly with any construction site. Lots of possibilities with regards to printed tile. Minifig has nice torso print. Good value. Excellent example of how, sometimes, simple is a good thing.

author: fuzthepoet
title: Road Worker
review:
I have bad nerve damage in my hands so my physical therapist recommended Lego's as good for fine motor skills practice.

This was my 5th build. This one is my favourite build yet. Lots of fun. For a low cost build it has some nice moving parts. I was worried there would be stickers from the pic but there are not the images are printed on the bricks!
